subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Mark Zuckerberg: From Dorm Room to Global Network
description: A fast breakdown of Mark Zuckerberg: From Dorm Room to Global Network for builders.

hook.text: Zuckerberg turned down a $1B Yahoo acquisition at age 22. Everyone thought he was insane.

buildup.text: Facebook launched in a Harvard dorm in 2004. Within two weeks, half the campus had signed up.

discovery.text: Zuckerberg's insight: network effects create winner-take-all markets. Being first and fast mattered most.

twist.text: The Winklevoss twins sued, claiming he stole their idea. The settlement: $65M. Facebook's value: $1 trillion.

climax.text: Facebook grew to 3 billion usersâ€”40% of humanity on a single platform.

punchline.text: The biggest bet was saying no to a billion dollars at 22.

quiz.question: Why did Zuckerberg refuse Yahoo's $1 billion acquisition offer?
options: He understood network effects would make Facebook far more valuable over time
Yahoo couldn't secure the necessary financing
Facebook's board of directors blocked the deal
